doc.title: Giant Biogene Holding (2367.HK): NBR takeaways: Resilient consumer sentiment observed; Look for online acceleration into Double 11 with
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS/Giant Biogene Holding (2367.HK)_ NDR takeaways_ Resilient consumer sentiment observed; Look for online acceleration into Double 11 with_2025-09-01

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS

passages.text: We hosted Giant Biogene's CFO, Board Secretary & CPO and IR team in HK with investors on Sep 1 post its 1H25 results (earnings review/briefing takeaways).

Overall, we walked away with more confidence of normalized growth into Double 11 given 1) intact consumer sentiment matrix (i.e., 35- 40% repeated purchase, 60% new consumer mix, and limited negative sentiment measurement index on RED), 2) above expected new star SKUs/product series and offline penetration offsetting the slower online growth of single- use- essence short term, and 3) mgmt's constructive tone on KOL resumption with execution details backed by adequate budget to spend. Top KOL, Austin Li, has gradually resumed promotion of Comfy's products on both his livestreaming and reality show in Aug, and Sun Jian, the top tier KOL on Douyin, just resumed livestreaming on Aug 31 of Comfy's star SKU, Luminous Facial Cream, with GMV achieved above expectation, per mgmt.

Maintain Buy as we believe the market has been over- concerned about the impact of the recent allegation around product content while underestimating the incremental drivers including new SKUs/product lines, new channels (i.e., offline store, Sephora, DFS, overseas) and multi- brand potential fundamentally backed by company's brand equity deeply rooted in its scientific background, proven product innovation capability and LT commitment in functional skincare to provide effective solutions for consumers.
Below we highlight key takeaways from the NDR:

1) Mgmt reiterated confidence to deliver FY25 guidance, with overall on-track key SKUs performance: Luminous Facial Cream/Tier-2 product lines will likely exceed expectations in 2025, per mgmt, while Single-use-essence might come in slightly slower mainly on the product content issue impact on 618 shopping festival. FY25 guidance implied 2H25 online growth at c.30% yoy, with Double 11 targeted slightly above that pace given Q3 is the seasonal trough;

2) Strong consumer trust observed and on-track KOL resumption: Earlier issue regarding the contents of its single-use essence had very limited impact on in-house/direct channels per mgmt, indicating strong consumer trust on product quality. There is no negative feedback on safety/efficacy from KOLs' quality control teams and top KOLs are resuming steadily - Austin Li and SUN Jian have (partly)

Goldman Sachs does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. For Reg AC certification and other important disclosures, see the Disclosure Appendix, or go to www.gs.com/research/hedge.html. Analysts employed by non- US affiliates are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA in the U.S.
resumed livestreaming, while management said they expect JIA Nai Liang to return soon;

3) Focus on star SKUs and maintain disciplined discount in Double 11: The company will focus on traditional star SKUs into Double 11. Per management, Double 11 discounts will be largely stable vs. 618 shopping festival, while perceived net price improvement will come from platform mechanisms (coupons, shopping credits).

4) New growth drivers from new SKUs, smaller brands, and offline: Mgmt is confident on the new Comfy SKU under Jiaodian series expected to launch in 1H26 benchmarking to single-use essence, targeting at core pain points for consumers and it sits in a fast-growing, on-trend category with an innovative positioning that currently lacks direct equivalents, plus two new series for different skin solutions to be launched in 2027-28. Smaller brands (e.g. Keyu (可预) and SKIGIN (欣昔)) are also expected to deliver strong performance next year. For offline, mgmt aims for 30+ stores by 2025-end (vs. current 24) and believes the Sephora channel will contribute more incremental sales over time, highlighting positive feedback on Precise and Intensive Repair series (顿域密修系列).
Echoing results briefing, mgmt reiterated 2025 guidance - sales/NI up 25- 28%/21- 24% yoy at RMB6.9- 7.1bn/2.5- 2.6bn.

- By-SKU performance: Mgmt expects Single use essence(胶原棒) to deliver slightly lower yoy growth in FY25, mainly reflecting the impact of the earlier product content issue on the 618 shopping festival, while highlighted the LT target of RMB3-4bn sales unchanged, with the 2.0 version product receiving strong customer feedback and still seeing 60-70% new customer mix and largely stable repurchase rate post the allegation. Luminous Facial Cream (焦点面霜) is expected to deliver better performance in FY25 vs. prior mgmt expectation at RMB400mn sales. Tier-2 products incl. Aqua Luminous series (吨吨系列), Ginsenoside series (秩序系列), and Comfy Lotion+Emulsion set, accounting for SD% of Comfy brand sales each, all grew faster than company total.

- Product pipeline: The company will launch a new SKU in 1H26. Mgmt is confident to reach the first year sales of single use essence at its launch year, given the SKU will target core pain points for consumers and it sits in a fast-growing, on-trend category with an innovative positioning that currently lacks direct equivalents, building on the company's past successes in adjacent categories. Another new series will also be launched in 2027-2028.
- ROI: Mgmt commented that online OI for Comfy brand is largely stable yoy.
- Collgene: The brand has been growing in line with mgmt expectation in 1H25, and the guidance for RMB1bn sales in FY25 is unchanged.

Smaller brands: Keyu (可预) generated over RMB100mn sales last year, and the scale this year will be similar to last year, with ongoing adjustments. The brand launched oral care and body care product series in 1H25 and has entered 10k OTC POS. In LT, the brand is targeted to become an one- stop household health care solution brand in LT. Keyu and SKIGIN (欣昔) will both deliver solid performance next year per mgm
In- house livestreaming: Mgmt commented that the impact of the product content issue on the in- house channel was limited, proving strong consumer trust in Comfy products.

KOL resumption: Mgmt indicates the overall cadence is close to last year's pattern and the number of live sessions has not decreased meaningfully once seasonal effects are considered. Top KOLs are steadily resuming per mgmt with no doubts in product quality and safety from KOLs' quality control team - Austin Li highlighted three Comfy products in his recent reality show in Paris; SUN Jian has run three livestreaming sessions for Collgene and resumed livestreaming for Comfy last week; JIA Nailiang's return is expected soon. Meanwhile, the company will leverage more KOLs that conduct day- to- day livestreamings to smooth the volatility of KOL livestreaming.

Double 11 strategy and outlook: The company will still focus on traditional star SKUs into Double 11 and maintain discipline on discounts - Double 11 discounts will be largely stable vs. 618 shopping festival while perceived net price improvement will come from platform mechanisms (coupons, shopping credits). The company will also collaborate with Umer (优麦), a learning platform for dermatologists, to further strengthen medical- level endorsement for Comfy. Mgmt FY25 guidance implied 2H25 online growth around \(30\%\) , with Double 11 targeted slightly above that pace given Q3 is the seasonal trough.

3. Offline channel: The company has 24 offline stores by 1H25-end and a target for 30+ by 2025-end. Sephora channel is expected to contribute more incremental sales over time; the brand entered in August with a focus on Precise and Intensive Repair series ( 帧域密修系列), which has been receiving positive feedback.
4. MA business progress: Three products are under NMPA's review with normal progress and no negative feedback. Mgmt has high confidence in their technology while final timing depends on NMPA review.
Valuation methodology: Our 12- month TP of HK\$71 is based on a 22x 2027E P/E discounted back to mid-2026E using a \(9.6\%\) COE.
Key risks: Slower- than- expected growth/intensified competition in the professional skin treatment market; inability to develop successful products; regulatory risk.
2367.HK12m Price Target: HK$71.00Price: HK$53.85Upside: 31.8%

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

The previous investment rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this stock and should not be relied upon. Coverage Suspended (CS). Goldman Sachs has suspended coverage of this company. Not Covered (NC). Goldman Sachs does not cover this company.
